thread.title: Retail Industry EMV Compliance Deadline Arrives Today - Credit Card Fraud Liability Shifts
thread.title_full: Retail Industry EMV Compliance Deadline Arrives Today - Credit Card Fraud Liability Shifts

author: McGuireWoods LLP
title: Retail Industry EMV Compliance Deadline Arrives Today - Credit Card Fraud Liability Shifts
text:
Retail Industry EMV Compliance Deadline Arrives Today - Credit Card Fraud Liability Shifts more+ <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=4ce412f9-8d67-4d3e-8109-46876aa65c9f" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
Credit card companies hope to expedite the new technology rollout through the pending change in liability rules. Under the prior rules, the card issuer assumed all liability for counterfeit or stolen credit card transactions. Under the new rules starting today, retailers who choose to accept payments via a credit card’ If the POS terminal and the card were both EMV-chip-enabled, whether the transaction was a “fallback” 
In order to be deemed EMV-compliant, retailers need to upgrade their POS terminals and review their software to ensure both can process the new technology. Cost estimates for converting the entire U.S. network range from
